column4: er, I looked up and saw your tangas thing, very funny ;p it (it's hard to read using this webchat thing). ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh $ that makes much more sense, yes, I have a C$ right there
haha, poor windows, nobody likes it
but, uh, wait.. I shared my C drive and, uh, I have three folders, ADMIN$, barboza (the name of the original admin), and C$
I get into barboza and I see the contents of C but I can't change anything
sorry if you have to repeat yourself but this webchat is terrible, I see half the things you say and I have to search the whole thing to try and find the rest
wait, ok, I'll unshare it, but
somethign has to be shared, hah =p
assuming someone has set up their client, it also highlights/alerts the person you're talking to.
which really helps in a crowded channel
:) I see that now. thanks a lot :)
so you can view and manipulate that PC, while on your PC
sorry, i don't do samba.. i thought your question was about vnc/remote desktop
thats an enthusiast in the making
i would if i were you, you'll find after a couple of months, Ubuntu/Linux is just as easy as Windows, it's just different, and you have to learn it all oer again
heh, right, but my family shuns me for trying it though, so, I'm deciding =p
